title: ATO scammers with eftpos machine and fake 'Federal Police' jacket knock on man's door
text:
Two men pretending to be from the Australian Taxation Office have turned up to a house with an EFTPOS machine - wearing Australian Federal Police uniforms demanding the owners pay an outstanding tax debt.

The victim had received a phone call on Monday afternoon claiming that he had an outstanding tax debt and a warrant had been issued for his arrest.

Half an hour later two men arrived at the man's house in Adelaide's northern suburbs wearing blue jackets with the words 'Federal Police' on them, a statement released by South Australia Police says.

Two men have turned up to a house with an EFTPOS machine and fake police uniforms pretending to be from the Australian Taxation Office and demanding money

The man, who did not want to be named, told the ABC the pair said they were from the Australian Federal Police and held out an eftpos machine saying he had a tax debt.

'They had handcuffs on their belt but I knew they weren't legit. Their jacket just said 'Federal Police' not AFP,' he said.

'If I hadn't have been home, my wife would have handed over the credit card.'

When the man asked the duo to show identification he said they ran off.

The two men are described as of Indian and Asian appearance with one in his 20s and the other in his 40s with an American accent.

'A quick call to the ATO confirmed there was no outstanding tax debt and the victim immediately reported the matter to police... No money was stolen,' SA Police said in a statement.

Northern District detectives have urged anyone who saw the two men or who have experienced similar incidents to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.

The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission said in a report earlier this year 'ATO scams' had increased by about 900 per cent.

Safety advice from the ACCC to avoid scams includes to call back the ATO directly to verify anything you have been told and to never give your financial details to anyone you do not trust.
description: Two men have turned up to a house in Adelaide with an eftpos machine and fake police uniforms pretending to be from the Australian Taxation Office and demanding money.
authors: Brett Lackey For Daily Mail Australia
